entry.title: If you like your coffee hot (let me be your coffee pot)
entry.summary:
Author: emme

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,407Chapters: 4/6Kudos: 90

Summary: Batman didn’t sleep; he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks. He didn’t acknowledge his injuries, his weaknesses, or his limitations. Batman was the night, and the night is relentless, unforgiving, unstoppable.Bruce, on the other hand… he didn’t sleep, he didn’t rest, nor did he take breaks either, but he desperately needed to. Clark couldn’t do much about that. He couldn’t very well force the man to take a nap (even if sometimes he wished he could just push him down on a flat surface, effectively close his eyes, and order him to sleep). What he could do, however, was ensure Bruce kept an adequate energy level, the kind of energy level that allows a human being to stand upright, walk, talk, and generally survive life with minimal discomfort.He… fed him. Clark fed him whenever he could.The situation was not spiraling out of control. He could very well handle things, and “acts of service” was not Superman’s love language. It was not.Or:Five times Clark brought food to Bruce and one time he didn’t have to, but he did it anyway.

entry.title: First Light
entry.summary:
Author: lighthouse_inkwell

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,092Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 100

Summary: Bruce Wayne is overwhelmed.In trying to get initiatives off the ground that will actually improve Gotham's infrastructure, he unwillingly goes on a press tour in Metropolis, where he is met with increasingly personal questions about his reappearance into society, and of course (as always) his parents tragic deaths. Panic attacks ensue, Bruce meets a particularly polite reporter who talks him out of it, but is met with a brand new problem when a miscommunication leads the public into thinking Bruce is dating said reporter.Clark convinces Bruce that answering questions about a fake relationship would be leagues easier than answering questions about dead parents. Bruce agrees. And totally not because Clark has the most charming smiling he's ever seen.

entry.title: And I don't wanna go home yet
entry.summary:
Author: LuiGarMir

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,646Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 93

Summary: When Clark met Bruce, he didn’t think much of the man. Well, no. He’d had thoughts—a lot of them having to do with his chiseled jaw and broad shoulders—but he hadn’t seen past Batman’s dark, gloomy, unknowable persona.The man—barely a young adult when they met—had been polite and deadly efficient, but also cold and distant.Clark, a journalist at heart, wanted to know more about him, but Superman understood how precious secrecy and privacy were. So… He gave Batman some space.It took him years to discover the man’s civilian name. And it just so happened to be around the same time both men started getting closer. Or it was maybe the reason why they got close at all.

entry.title: The Baddams Family Adventures
entry.summary:
Author: petting_a_bumblebee

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 38,465Chapters: 21/23Kudos: 1,217

Summary: Flash halted as a shadowy tendril leaped from Batman’s cape and slithered toward the side table. The tendril snatched a pie knife while its identical twin took a plate from the near pile. They cut a hefty piece, which they delivered to Batman’s waiting hand. Batman took a long and audible sniff off the treat before the slice and the plate vanished into his shadows.“As Flash stated, it is tasty”, Batman said emphatically in the sudden silence of the meeting room. “The plate was not bad either. IKEA?”- Batboy-centric glimpses of the life of the most lovable monster family in Gotham.
